intro: Conyza hypoleuca, commonly known as white cockle, is an annual flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its small white to pale yellow flowers bloom in the summer, and it produces numerous tiny seeds that are dispersed by wind. Conyza hypoleuca is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain environments.
